##### FILE: elastic-stack1_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack12_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/kibana-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: kibana-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
  name: kibana-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kibana-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: kibana-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
          value: http://elasticsearch-logging:9200
        image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana-oss:6.2.4
        name: kibana-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5601
          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

##### FILE: elastic-stack13_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack14_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack14_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack15_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/kibana-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: kibana-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
  name: kibana-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kibana-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: kibana-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
          value: http://elasticsearch-logging:9200
        image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana-oss:6.2.4
        name: kibana-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5601
          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack17_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack17_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack17_9.yaml #####

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/kibana-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: kibana-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
  name: kibana-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kibana-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: kibana-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
          value: http://elasticsearch-logging:9200
        image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana-oss:6.2.4
        name: kibana-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5601
          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

##### FILE: elastic-stack18_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

##### FILE: elastic-stack19_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack19_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system

    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

##### FILE: elastic-stack2_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/kibana-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: kibana-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
  name: kibana-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kibana-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: kibana-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
          value: http://elasticsearch-logging:9200
        image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana-oss:6.2.4
        name: kibana-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5601
          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack3_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack4_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack4_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack5_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/Deployment/kibana-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: kibana-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
  name: kibana-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kibana-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: kibana-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTICSEARCH_URL
          value: http://elasticsearch-logging:9200
        image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana-oss:6.2.4
        name: kibana-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5601
          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

##### FILE: elastic-stack6_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/DaemonSet/fluentd:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: fluentd-logging
    version: v1
  name: fluentd
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-logging
      version: v1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-logging
        version: v1
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: K8S_NODE_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: spec.nodeName
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_HOST
          value: elasticsearch-logging
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_PORT
          value: "9200"
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_SCHEME
          value: http
        - name: FLUENTD_SYSTEMD_CONF
          value: disable
        - name: FLUENT_CONTAINER_TAIL_EXCLUDE_PATH
          value: /var/log/containers/fluent*
        - name: FLUENT_CONTAINER_TAIL_PARSER_TYPE
          value: /^(?<time>.+) (?<stream>stdout|stderr)( (?<logtag>.))? (?<log>.*)$/
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_SSL_VERIFY
          value: "true"
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_SSL_VERSION
          value: TLSv1_2
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_USER
          value: elastic
        - name: FLUENT_ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD
          value: changeme
        image: fluent/fluentd-kubernetes-daemonset:v1-debian-elasticsearch
        name: fluentd
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 200Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/log/pods
          name: dockercontainerlogdirectory
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      serviceAccount: fluentd
      serviceAccountName: fluentd
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      tolerations:
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: node-role.kubernetes.io/control-plane
      - effect: NoSchedule
        key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log/pods
        name: dockercontainerlogdirectory
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-config
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack7_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/DaemonSet/fluentd-es-v2.2.0:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: elastic-stack7_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging

---

kind: Deployment

    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"

        name: kibana-logging
        ports:

          name: ui
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

##### FILE: elastic-stack8_8.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: fluentd-es
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v2.2.0
  name: fluentd-es-v2.2.0
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: fluentd-es
      version: v2.2.0
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
        scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod: ""
        seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod: docker/default
      labels:
        k8s-app: fluentd-es
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v2.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FLUENTD_ARGS
          value: --no-supervisor -q
        image: k8s.gcr.io/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.2.0
        name: fluentd-es
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 500Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 200Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/log
          name: varlog
        - mountPath: /var/lib/docker/containers
          name: varlibdockercontainers
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/fluent/config.d
          name: config-volume
      priorityClassName: system-node-critical
      serviceAccountName: fluentd-es
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/log
        name: varlog
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/docker/containers
        name: varlibdockercontainers
      - configMap:
          name: fluentd-es-config-v0.1.4
        name: config-volume

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v6.2.5
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v6.2.5
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v6.2.5
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v6.2.5
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      name: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 31Gi
      storageClassName: cloud-ssd

##### FILE: elastic-statefulset.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-logging/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: kube-logging
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: k8s-logs
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.2.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 2Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 1Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 10Gi
      storageClassName: do-block-storage

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to bitcoin/Deployment/electrs:

kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: electrs
  namespace: bitcoin
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: electrs
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: electrs
    spec:
      containers:
      - env: null
        image: philipcristiano/electrs:0.10.3
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: electrs
        ports:
        - containerPort: 50001
          protocol: TCP
        resources: {}
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: electrs-vol
        - mountPath: /root/.electrs/config.toml
          name: electrs-conf
          readOnly: true
          subPath: config.toml
      restartPolicy: Always
      volumes:
      - name: electrs-vol
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: electrs-pvc
      - name: electrs-conf
        secret:
          secretName: electrs-conf

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to matrix/Deployment/element:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: element
  namespace: matrix
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: element
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: element
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: vectorim/element-web:latest
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: element
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
        name: element
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: element
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: element
          initialDelaySeconds: 2
          periodSeconds: 3
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /app/config.json
          name: config-volume
          subPath: config.json
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: element-config
        name: config-volume

    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: add-netpol-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: allow-dns
  namespace: elympics
spec:
  egress:
  - ports:
    - port: 53
      protocol: UDP
    to:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          name: kube-system
  podSelector:
    matchLabels: {}
  policyTypes:
  - Egress

---

              key: BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS

          value: email_consumer

          value: live.smtp.mailtrap.io

          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MAIL_PASSWORD
              name: mail-secrets

          value: "2525"

          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MAIL_USERNAME
              name: mail-secrets

          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: SASL_PASSWORD
              name: kafka-secrets

          valueFrom:

              key: SASL_USERNAME
              name: kafka-secrets

##### FILE: email-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/email-ms:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  annotations:
    kompose.cmd: kompose convert -f docker-compose.yaml
    kompose.version: 1.33.0 (HEAD)
  labels:
    io.kompose.service: email-ms
  name: email-ms
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      io.kompose.service: email-ms
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        kompose.cmd: kompose convert -f docker-compose.yaml
        kompose.version: 1.33.0 (HEAD)
      labels:
        io.kompose.service: email-ms
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: BROKER_KAFKA
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: BROKER_KAFKA
              name: email-credentials
        - name: USERNAME_KAFKA
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: USERNAME_KAFKA
              name: email-credentials
        - name: PASSWORD_KAFKA
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: PASSWORD_KAFKA
              name: email-credentials
        - name: HOST_MAIL
          value: mailhog:1025
        - name: POST_MAIL
          value: "1025"
        image: drew138/email-microservice:v1
        name: email-ms
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 300m
          requests:
            cpu: 150m
            memory: 1000Mi
      restartPolicy: Always

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/email-ms

skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/email-ms

##### FILE: emailservice1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emailservice:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: DISABLE_PROFILER
          value: "1"
        image: emailservice
        livenessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          privileged: false
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
        runAsGroup: 1000
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 1000
      serviceAccountName: default
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 5

---

##### FILE: emailservice14.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emailservice:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: DISABLE_PROFILER
          value: "1"
        image: gcr.io/google-samples/microservices-demo/emailservice:v0.9.0
        livenessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          privileged: false
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
        runAsGroup: 1000
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 1000
      serviceAccountName: default
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 5

---

##### FILE: emailservice19.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emailservice:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: DISABLE_PROFILER
          value: "1"
        image: gcr.io/google-samples/microservices-demo/emailservice:v0.2.3
        livenessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - /bin/grpc_health_probe
            - -addr=:8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - /bin/grpc_health_probe
            - -addr=:8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: acr-secret
      serviceAccountName: default
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 5

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: emailservice
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
      project: hipstershop
      tier: app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
        project: hipstershop
        tier: app
    spec:
      containers:
      - envFrom:
        - configMapRef:
            name: emailservice
        image: srikanthhg/emailservice:v1
        name: email
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi

##### FILE: emailservice25.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emailservice:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: emailservice
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: DISABLE_PROFILER
          value: "1"
        image: emailservice
        livenessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          privileged: false
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
        runAsGroup: 1000
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 1000
      serviceAccountName: default
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 5

---

##### FILE: emailservice7.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emailservice:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: emailservice
  name: emailservice
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: DISABLE_PROFILER
          value: "1"
        image: emailservice
        livenessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        name: server
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          privileged: false
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
        runAsGroup: 1000
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 1000
      serviceAccountName: default
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 5

---

    matchLabels:
      app: emailservice

    metadata:

        app: emailservice
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PORT
          value: "8080"

          value: "1"
        - name: DISABLE_TRACKING
          value: "1"

          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5

        - containerPort: 8080
        readinessProbe:
          grpc:
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5

            cpu: 200m
            memory: 128Mi

            cpu: 100m
            memory: 64Mi

apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-networkpolicy-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: add-netpol-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: allow-dns
  namespace: emojivoto
spec:
  egress:
  - ports:
    - port: 53
      protocol: UDP
    to:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          name: kube-system
  podSelector:
    matchLabels: {}
  policyTypes:
  - Egress

    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno

    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: generate-resourcequota
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1

    limits.cpu: "4"
    limits.memory: 16Gi
    requests.cpu: "4"
    requests.memory: 16Gi

kind: Deployment
metadata:

    app.kubernetes.io/name: web
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: emojivoto
    app.kubernetes.io/version: v11
  name: web
  namespace: emojivoto

  replicas: 1

    matchLabels:
      app: web-svc
      version: v11

    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web-svc
        version: v11
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: WEB_PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: EMOJISVC_HOST
          value: emoji-svc.emojivoto:8080
        - name: VOTINGSVC_HOST
          value: voting-svc.emojivoto:8080

          value: dist/index_bundle.js
        image: docker.l5d.io/buoyantio/emojivoto-web:v11

        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http
        resources:

    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: emojivoto

##### FILE: employee-deploy.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/employee-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: employee
  name: employee-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: employee
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: employee
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: shubhamk0/employee:1
        name: employee-container
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: config-volume
      initContainers:
      - args:
        - kubectl get configmap employee-configmap -o=jsonpath='{.data.config\.yaml}'
          > /config/config.yaml
        command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        image: kubectl:latest
        name: fetch-config
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: config-volume
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: config-volume

---

##### FILE: employee-service.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/employee-app:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app-label: employee-app
  name: employee-app
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app-label: employee-app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app-label: employee-app
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: address.service.url
          value: http://address-service:8081/address
        envFrom:
        - secretRef:
            name: employee-db-secrets
        image: ssamantr/employee-service:1.0.0
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: employee-app
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: employee-port
        readinessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /actuator/health/readiness
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 2000m
            memory: 2000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        startupProbe:
          failureThreshold: 35
          httpGet:
            path: /actuator/health/liveness
            port: 8080
          periodSeconds: 2

---

##### FILE: empty_dir_volume.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emptydir-volume:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: emptydir-volume
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emptydir-volume
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: emptydir-volume
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - -c
        - touch /foo/bar.txt && sleep 3600
        command:
        - /bin/sh
        image: busybox
        name: one
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 128Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /foo
          name: cache
        - mountPath: /thumbnails
          name: thumbnails
      - command:
        - sleep
        - "3600"
        image: busybox
        name: two
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 128Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /foo
          name: cache
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: cache
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: thumbnails

---

##### FILE: emptyDir_10.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/counter:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: counter
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    - |
      i=0; while true; do
        echo "$i: $(date)" >> /var/log/1.log;
        echo "$(date) INFO $i" >> /var/log/2.log;
        i=$((i+1));
        sleep 1;
      done
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: count
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: varlog
  - args:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    - tail -n+1 -F /var/log/1.log
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: count-log-1
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: varlog
  - args:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    - tail -n+1 -F /var/log/2.log
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: count-log-2
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: varlog
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: varlog

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Pod/counter
policy disallow-default-namespace -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:
1 - validate-namespace validation error: Using 'default' namespace is not allowed. rule validate-namespace failed at path /metadata/namespace/

policy drop-all-capabilities -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:
1 - require-drop-all validation failure: Containers must drop `ALL` capabilities.

policy drop-cap-net-raw -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:
1 - require-drop-cap-net-raw validation failure: Containers must drop the `CAP_NET_RAW` capability.

policy require-labels -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:
1 - check-for-labels validation error: The label `app.kubernetes.io/name` is required. rule check-for-labels failed at path /metadata/labels/

policy require-requests-limits -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:
1 - validate-resources validation error: CPU and memory resource requests and memory limits are required for containers. rule validate-resources failed at path /spec/containers/0/resources/

policy require-pod-probes -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:

policy require-ro-rootfs -> resource default/Pod/counter failed:

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to /Pod/:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata: null
name: my-pod
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - /bin/sh
    - -ec
    - ls /mnt/data; sleep 999999
    image: busybox
    name: my-container
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /mnt/data
      name: my-volume
      subPath: symlink-door
  emptyDir: {}
  initContainers:
  - command:
    - bin/sh
    - -ec
    - ln -s / /mnt/data/symlink-door
    image: busybox
    name: prep-symlink
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /mnt/data
      name: my-volume
  volumes:
  - name: my-volume

        name: my-container
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /
          name: my-volume
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: my-volume

##### FILE: emptyDir_18.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/subpath:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: subpath
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - -c
    - cd /rootfs && rm -rf hostetc && ln -s / /rootfs/host && touch /status/done &&
      sleep infinity
    command:
    - /bin/bash
    image: nginx:latest
    imagePullPolicy: Always
    name: setup
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /rootfs
      name: escape-volume
    - mountPath: /status
      name: status-volume
  - args:
    - -c
    - if [[ -f /status/done ]];then sleep infinity; else sleep 1; fi
    command:
    - /bin/bash
    image: nginx:latest
    imagePullPolicy: Always
    name: exploit
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /rootfs
      name: escape-volume
      subPath: host
    - mountPath: /status
      name: status-volume
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: escape-volume
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: status-volume

---

kind: Pod

      value: "8090"

    name: myboot-demo-2

      name: demo-volume

  - emptyDir: {}
    name: demo-volume

    - /bin/sh

    volumeMounts:

      name: shared-data
  restartPolicy: Never
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: shared-data

    - -c

        echo "$(date) INFO hello" >> /var/log/myapp.log ;
        sleep 1;
      done

    name: application

    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: log

    - /bin/sh
    - -c

    image: busybox
    name: sidecar

    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: log

  - emptyDir: {}

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/counter:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: counter
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - /bin/sh
    - -c
    - |
      i=0; while true; do
        echo "$i: $(date)" >> /var/log/1.log;
        echo "$(date) INFO $i" >> /var/log/2.log;
        i=$((i+1));
        sleep 1;
      done
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: count
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /var/log
      name: varlog
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: varlog

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: mongo-emptydir-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: mongo-app
  template:

      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: mongo-app
      name: mongo-pod
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --dbpath
        - /data/db
        env:
        - name: MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME
          value: admin
        - name: MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD
          value: password
        image: mongo
        name: mongo-container
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongo-volume
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: mongo-volume

##### FILE: emptydir_limit.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/emptydir-stress-limit:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: emptydir-stress-limit
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: emptydir-stress-limit
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: emptydir-stress-limit
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - |
          i=0; while true; do
            echo "iteration $i";
            dd if=/dev/zero of=/data/file$i bs=10M count=1024;
            i=$((i+1));
          done;
        command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        image: busybox
        name: fill-disk-container
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: temp-storage
      nodeSelector:
        env: test
      volumes:
      - emptyDir:
          sizeLimit: 2Gi
        name: temp-storage

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/emptydir-stress-limit
policy disallow-default-namespace -> resource default/Deployment/emptydir-stress-limit failed:

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/myvolemptydir:

kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: myvolemptydir
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - /bin/bash
    - -c
    - sleep 15000
    image: centos
    name: centos1
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /xchange
      name: xchange
  - command:
    - /bin/bash
    - -c
    - sleep 10000
    image: centos
    name: centos2
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /tmp/data
      name: xchange
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: xchange

---
